item.title: Report E-2024040680
item.description:
Report E-2024040680

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-24
  • City: LEHIGHTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2in-by-15ft area of the trailer floor and 10ft-by-5ft area of the concrete terminal dock and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to a damaged 55-gallon poly drum. Enviroserve personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and used absorbent pads to gather the spent material. The recovered absorbents were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum was emptied into two (2) 30-gallon poly drums and the damaged 55-gallon was over-packed into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2024041436

  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: shipment taken out of system flow due to package leaking package found in trailer# 826447 already damaged leaking upon inspection of inner contents 1 x 50lbs plastic pail/drum of calcium hypochlorite the 50lbs plastic pail/drum was cracked broken and leaking allowing 5lbs to release. no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition

item.title: Report E-2024040662
item.description:
Report E-2024040662

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-02T15:12:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2024, four (4) 50-pound bags of UN3260 were torn during loading and released approximately three (3) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the UN3260-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged onsite for transport and disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED BY SUPERVISOR AT THE END OF SUNRISE THAT THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING IN A PACKAGE CAR. RESPONDER WENT TO THE PACKAGE CAR AND TOOK THE BUCKET THAT WAS LEAKING TO PROCESS IT. ALSO CLEANED OUT THE PACKAGE CAR AND REBOXED THE PACKAGES THAT WERE WET. NO OTHER PRODUCT WAS DAMAGED.
